name: Dysthymia
description:
FullScreen required for the intended experience

The video game follows a minor who lives in an environment of constant academic pressure from his parents, who exert creative repression on him as it "distracts" him from the goals they have set for him.

Due to stress, the protagonist develops a series of psychological conditions such as introversion, depression, and fear of loneliness and darkness, better known as PDD (Persistent Depressive Disorder). This leads him to see reality in another way in search of an escape, which is strongly represented by his imagination and the creation of an imaginary friend.

The players will see the world through the child's imagination and will help him to go through different situations present within his home, controlling his movement and the interaction with his imaginary friend who acts as his protector or guardian.

Code: Thomas Guana

Art: Juan Pablo Perez F.
